title: Explain how -gui-address should look like in syncthing -h

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good starting points for new contributors

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
```
  -gui-address=""  Override GUI address
```

isn't very verbose and `bin/syncthing -gui-address="192.168.179.1:8384"` doesn't work - but even if it would it should still be explained. Failure is

```
[monitor] 14:18:44 INFO: Starting syncthing
[3YISR] 14:18:44 INFO: syncthing v0.12.8+2-g348d12b "Beryllium Bedbug" (go1.5.1 linux-amd64) richter@richter-Lenovo-IdeaPad-Z500 2015-12-14 12:18:51 UTC
[3YISR] 14:18:44 INFO: My ID: 3YISRPP-QS6S66M-4V3JLPZ-G7PXUG3-6HNCTFT-XIPTNZY-RMF4A23-2APEIAC
[3YISR] 14:18:45 INFO: Single thread hash performance is ~173 MB/s

[monitor] 14:18:46 INFO: Starting syncthing

[3YISR] 14:18:47 INFO: My ID: 3YISRPP-QS6S66M-4V3JLPZ-G7PXUG3-6HNCTFT-XIPTNZY-RMF4A23-2APEIAC
```

Establishing the connection works fine with the 0.12.8 binary release, so this issue shall be about the feedback of help. I might open another issue for the failure.

experienced with v0.12.4-20-g1ebc9a9 and v0.12.8-2-g348d12b
